text: Block of granulocytic differentiation of 32Dcl3 cells by AML1 / ETO ( MTG8 ) but not by highly expressed <extra_id_0> Bcl-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
The chimeric gene , AML1 / ETO ( MTG8 ) , generated in t ( 8 ; 21 ) acute myeloid leukemia enhances the expression of <extra_id_0> Bcl-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

To evaluate whether this enhancement is the primary role of AML1 / ETO in leukemogenesis , effects of over-expression of <extra_id_0> Bcl-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in the murine myeloid precursor cell line , 32Dcl3 , were examined .
When 32Dcl3 cells expressing exogenous <extra_id_0> Bcl-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> were induced to differentiate , the onset of morphological differentiation was delayed .

However , even the cells expressing very high levels of exogenous <extra_id_0> Bcl-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> eventually underwent differentiation without a significant decrease in the synthesis of <extra_id_0> Bcl-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

On the contrary , 32Dcl3 cells stably expressing AML1 / ETO were completely resistant to differentiation and continued to grow in the presence of <extra_id_0> G-CSF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
These results are consistent with the interpretation that stimulation of <extra_id_0> Bcl-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression is not the primary target of AML1 / ETO .
